bibl.title: Letter from Lucy T. Howard to Philip Showalter Hench, August 30, 1946

div1.p: Howard informs Hench that she cannot find any correspondence between her father and Lazear.

div1.head: Letter from Lucy T. Howard to Philip Showalter Hench, August 30, 1946
div1.opener:
August 30
1946
CHIPMUNK
ONTEORA CLUB
TANNERSVILLE, NEW YORK
Dear Dr Hench:
div1.p:
Please forgive
me for delaying to answer your
interesting letter & to thank
you for your paper on the “Conquer-
ors of Yellow Fever” which
Father & I are both delighted
to see. Incidentally My doctor
who was here at dinner
the other night saw it on my
table & was Most interested
& impressed & asked how
I happened to know you who
he knew by reputation!

I have finally gone through
the trunk of papers I shoke
to you about & can find
no letters from or to Lazaer.
I am so sorry. If there were
any I can't imagine where
they could be. In fact
the only thing I could find
bearing on the subject are
the things I send with
this which May or May
not interest you. Would
you be good enough to send
them back when you are
through with them?

I am awfully sorry I can't
help you more.

We enjoyed seeing you so much when
you came out to Bronxville last spring.
I am still hoping to move to Washington
by next spring - but no sign of a place
to move to yet.

With renewed thanks for the
paper & with greetings from Father &
me both-
